intro: Peltastes stemmadeniiflorus, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant characterized by its striking golden-yellow blooms. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is native to certain regions of South America. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along its stem. Its flowers are tubular and typically appear in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
